definitions.definition: The complete loss of voluntary control of part of a person's body, such as one or more limbs .
A state of being unable to act.
examples: The government has been in a paralysis since it lost its majority in the parliament.

main_definition: ( pathology ) The complete loss of voluntary control of part of a person's body, such as one or more limbs .
secondary_definitions: A state of being unable to act.
